Headline: One death and several injuries are reported during a protest over lack of water and other services in Sao Paulo, Brazil
Description: On July 18 in Valinhos, Sao Paulo, Brazil approximately 400 people protest the lack of water and inadequate school and health assistance in the Marielle Vive Camp. A supporter of Jair Bolsonaro drives a truck through the crowd, killing an elderly man and injuring five people, including a journalist.

Headline: In an attack on a convoy escorting food and water supplies, at least three are killed and one injured in Burkina Faso
Description: On June 24, in an attack on a convoy escorting food and water supplies in Burkina Faso, at least three people are killed and one is injured. No one claims responsibility for the attack.
Sources: National Consortium for the Study of Terrorism and Responses to Terrorism (START) 2019 ID. 201906240011

Headline: Disputes between herders and farmers over access to water lead to growing violence in Chad
Description: Herders and farmers who used to coexist peacefully are now inflicting deadly wounds on each other over fights driven by water shortages in the Sahel region of Chad.

Headline: Chilean social unrest tied to cost of living -- including water and power -- and inequality turn violent
Description: Protests in Chile include general civil unrest and reflect dissatisfaction in social and economic inequality, including the price of water and other utilities. Protests grow and turn violent with thousands injured and several dying during clashes with security forces.

Headline: A violent demonstration over access to water in Panquehue, Chile ends in the destruction of a local water system
Description: A group of citizens demonstrated violently in Panquehue, Chile in the Valparaiso Region. The group destroyed water facilities used for farming claiming that drought and industrial use is leading to water shortages for local residents.

Headline: A demonstration over water privatization and indigenous rights in Chile leads to a violent confrontation with police
Description: On October 12, in Santiago, Chile a Mapuche demonstration over the defense of indigenous territories and the privatization of water leads to a violent confrontation with police and the destruction of public facilities.

Headline: Protests over water, electricity, and university fees in the Democratic Republic of Congo turn violent At least four deaths are reported
Description: Students from the University of Lubumbashi demonstrate over water, electricity, and fees. The demonstrators barricade roads, block access to the university, and burn tires and vehicles. Police forces opened fire on the demonstrators, killing three. A police officer also dies after being hit by a police car.

Headline: Violence erupts in rural Ghana between Chokosis and Bimobas communities as groups fight over land and access to water resources
Description: In Chereponi district, Ghana, houses are burned to the ground, animals are killed, and many flee as violence erupts along ethnic lines between Chokosis and Bimobas peoples who are fighting over land and water resources.

Headline: Two people accused on stealing water pumps are beaten in Guatemala
Description: On June 27, in Zona 8, Mixco Town, Guatemala, two people who allegedly stole water pumps are beaten by a group of local inhabitants.

Headline: A dispute related to access to clean water in Haiti leads to multiple deaths and arrests
Description: On July 1, shots are fired at protestors demanding clean drinking water, killing two near Petite-Riviere de Nippes and Anse-a-Veau, Haiti. Unidentified people fire back, killing four more. Some of the initial attackers are arrested by police.

Headline: Demonstrators in Honduras opposed to a mine due to impacts on local water and forests destroy equipment; multiple injuries are reported
Description: On August 16 in Yorito, Yoro, Honduras around 600 inhabitants destroy heavy machinery of the mining company Comercializadora de Agregados de Honduras S.A. (CEASA). During the conflict with police, multiple injuries are reported. The demonstrators oppose the operation of the mining company, which they consider threatens water sources and the forest. The territory is inhabited by Tolupan indigenous people.

Headline: One death reported in a fight over water in southern India during a severe heat wave
Description: In Tamil Nadu, India, a 33 year old man dies as the result of a fight that broke out over water. India is experiencing a heat wave with temperatures reaching higher than 50 degrees C/120 degrees F.

Headline: One man stabs six others in a fight over water shortages in Ranchi, India during severe heat wave
Description: In Ranchi, India, one man stabs six other people due to water shortages. India is experiencing a heat wave with temperatures reaching higher than 50 degrees C/120 degrees F.

Headline: India responds to deadly attack by threatening to curtal water deliveries to Pakistan
Description: An attack by a Pakistan-based group that killed at least 40 Indian soldiers has worsened tensions between the two countries, prompting Indian leaders to threaten to curtail water deliveries from rivers flowing into Pakistan. Curtailment of water deliveries could undermine the 1960 Indus Water Treaty, which stipulates the sharing of water resources between the two countries.

Headline: A man is stabbed by his neighbor over a water sharing dispute in India
Description: A man is stabbed by his neighbor over a water sharing dispute in Chennai, India. Current drought and water supply management problems have led to lack of water for millions living in the city.

Headline: A grandmother and her grandson are beaten when seeking water from a private well
Description: A grandmother and her grandson in Badhauli village, Sultanpur, UP, India insist on being allowed to use a private well to get water. The well owner refuses and sends men to beat the grandmother and grandson with sticks, injuring them both. The owner is concerned that his well cannot provide water to the entire village and therefore, he does not want to provide water to anyone.

Headline: Numerous fights, including attacks on water tankers, break out over access to water in Madhya Pradesh, India during severe heat
Description: Water shortages in Madhya Pradesh, India intensify during a heat wave, leading to numerous violent conflicts among Indian civilians. In one instance in Khajrana a water truck driver is beaten. In another instance in Panna, eight people are injured during a fight. The local government responds to the violence by ordering police to escort water trucks.

Headline: Two men are seriously injured in clash over access to water in India
Description: Two men are seriously injured in a clash over water in Krishna Nagar Colony, India.

Headline: On two days in May, assailants set fire to water tankers and  other vehicles at construction sites in India
Description: On May 8 and again on May 12, assailants set fire to water tankers and other construction vehicles and a building in Maharashtra, India. Maoists are suspected to be responsible for the attacks.
Sources: National Consortium for the Study of Terrorism and Responses to Terrorism (START) 2019 ID. 201905080014, 201905120043

Headline: Vehicles and machines at a water pipeline construction site are burned in India
Description: On September 28, vehicles and machines at a water pipeline construction site are burned in Masenar, Chhattisgarh, India. Maoists are suspected to be responsible for the attacks.
Sources: National Consortium for the Study of Terrorism and Responses to Terrorism (START) 2019 ID. 201909280055

Headline: Caste violence in India continues, with access to water and water resources being regular triggers or casualties of conflict
Description: Marginalized socioeconomic groups, known as "Dalits" in the Hindu-based caste system, experience threats, torture, and violence when seeking access to water in Maharashtra, India. Dalit women are targets of violence in particular. Additionally, water sources used by Dalits are at times purposely contaminated with human excrement.

Headline: A woman is killed in a clash over the sharing of drinking water in Kurnool, India
Description: On May 10, in Kurnool district (Andhra Pradesh), India a woman is killed during a clash between two families over sharing of drinking water.

Headline: Six Dalits are injured in a clash over access to drinking water in Mainpuri, India
Description: On May 28, six Dalits, a marginalized socioeconomic group, were injured in an attack in Mainpuri (Uttar Pradesh), India over drinking water from a tube well.

Headline: Eight people are injured in a fight over water in Pawai, Madhya Pradesh, India
Description: On June 5, residents of Pawai village (Panna district, Madhya Pradesh), India attack each other following a dispute over water. Eight people were injured.

Headline: Seven people injured during dispute over water supply in Rajasthan, India
Description: On June 6, residents of two villages near Kishangarh Bas (Alwar district, Rajasthan), India clash with each other following a dispute over water supply in the neighborhood. Seven people were injured in the fight.

Headline: Six injuries are reported in a dispute over water in Mundera, Madhya Pradesh, India
Description: On June 8, locals residents attack each other following a dispute over water at Mundera village of Lavkush Nagar Tehsil (Chhatarpur district, Madhya Pradesh). Six people are injured in the clash.

Headline: One person is severely injured in a water dispute in Gwalior, Madhya Pradesh, India
Description: Around June 8, a youth is attacked with baseball bats by unidentified people in Gwalior (Madhya Pradesh) over a water dispute. The victim sustains severe injuries.

Headline: One injury is reported in a fight over drainage water in Devsar town, India
Description: On July 5, two families fight over a water drainage issue in Devsar town (Kulgam, Jammu and Kashmir), India. One injury is reported.

Headline: Five people are injured in a clash over sharing irrigation water in India
Description: On February 22, five persons are injured in a clash between two groups of farmers over sharing irrigation water at Singhi village near Bolpur (Birbhum, West Bengal), India. They use bamboo sticks and crude bombs in the clash.

Headline: A dispute over sewage water discharge leads to one death in India
Description: On March 18, in Kalakkad (Tiruppur, Tamil Nadu), India, a dispute over sewage water discharge leads to one death.

Headline: A dispute over sewage water discharge leads to two deaths and four injuries in India
Description: On March 30, two groups clash over the drainage of dirty water in Lisana village (Rewari, Haryana), India. Two persons are killed and four others injured in the clash.

Headline: One person is killed in a clash over the distribution of irrigation water in India
Description: On April 8, a youth was killed during a clash between groups from two villages in Shopian district (Jammu and Kashmir), India over the distribution of irrigation water.

Headline: In Chittoor, India, five people are injured in a dispute over a panchayat (village council) water connection
Description: On April 27, in Gudupalle Mandal area (Chittoor, Andhra Pradesh), two groups clash over a panchayat water connection at Alugumanupalle. Five persons are injured.

Headline: One death is reported in dispute over water at a public tap in Andhra Pradesh, India
Description: On July 15, a woman is killed during a clash over water between two groups at a public tap in the Srikakulam district (Andhra Pradesh), India.

Headline: Farmers in the Punjab, India fight over irrigation water. One injury is reported
Description: On July 21, farmers fight in Lubanianwali village (Muktsar, Punjab) after a farmer stops rainwater flow from a pipe. One person is injured.

Headline: Violence between Hindu and Muslim farmers over irrigation water in Uttar Pradesh, India leads to one injury and two arrests
Description: Around July 15, Hindus and Muslims clash in Semra village (Agra district, Uttar Pradesh), India over a farm field water channel. Two people are arrested and one injured.

Headline: A man is beaten to death for allegedly stealing a water pump in Rajasthan, India
Description: On September 21, a Dalit man is beaten to death by locals for allegedly stealing a water pump at Ghatoli village (Jhalawar, Rajasthan), India.

Headline: One man is killed and his son injured in a dispute over drawing water in Maharastra, India
Description: On October 6, two men attack a Muslim father and son over drawing water from a nearby tap in Ghatkopar (Mumbai Suburban, Maharashtra), India. The father dies of his injuries at a hospital.

Headline: A fight over restoration of a drinking water tap in AP, India injures eight
Description: On October 28, Telugu Desam Party (TDP) and Yuvajana Shramika Rythu Congress Party activists clash over the restoration of a drinking water tap in Santakaviti village (Srikakulam, Andhra Pradesh), India, injuring eight.

Headline: Six people are injured and one killed in a dispute over irrigation water in Uttar Pradesh, India
Description: On October 15, two groups of villagers from Kataura and Pradhan Paksha, Uttar Pradesh, India clash over irrigation water. Six persons are injured. The dispute continues in late October and a death is reported.

Headline: Four are injured in a fight over water supply in Kurnool, AP, India
Description: On November 16, four persons are injured in a clash between villagers and local leaders belonging to the Yuvajana Shramika Rythu Congress Party over drinking water at Kalvabugga (Kurnool, Andhra Pradesh), India.

Headline: Two are injured in a dispute over access to water in Uttar Pradesh, India
Description: On August 7, two persons are injured in a clash between two families in Bhadri village (Pratapgarh, Uttar Pradesh), India over taking water from a tap.

Headline: Violence over access to local water leads to gunfire and injuries in India
Description: On April 17, two rival groups, including a local official, clash at Kotla Doom village (Amritsar, Punjab) in a dispute over a village pond water/land. Both groups accused the other of gunfire, with two persons injured.

Headline: Two deaths and multiple injuries reported in violence over irrigation water in two villages of India
Description: On August 4, two villages clash over sharing irrigation water for their crops in the villages of Sagar and Panchagochhia, India. Two people are killed and 15 injured.

Headline: At least 12 people are injured in a clash over rainwater drainage pipes in Haryana, India
Description: On April 19, two groups of residents clash over the laying of rainwater drainage pipes in Mollewali village in Pinjore sub-division (Panchkula, Haryana), India. At least 12 injuries are reported.

Headline: Two people are injured in a water dispute in Indore, Madhya Pradesh, India
Description: In early June, a clash over water occurs between two groups in Indore (Madhya Pradesh), India. Two people are injured in the encounter.

Headline: Several people are injured in a fight over a water tanker in Delhi, India
Description: On June 10, two groups of residents clash over a water tanker in Delhi-Mehrauli (South Delhi, National Capital Territory of Delhi) injuring several people. The state has been facing water shortages.

Headline: Protestors trying to stop the diversion of floodwaters in Dashte Azadegan, Iran clash with Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps forces; one death is reported
Description: On March 4, clashes break out between Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) forces and protestors trying to stop the diversion of floodwaters in Dashte Azadegan, Iran. One protestor reportedly dies after being shot by IRGC forces.

Headline: Farmers protesting the diversion of the Zayandehrud River damage diversion water pipes
Description: In October, a group of farmers in Isfahan, Iran demonstrate against the diversion of Zayandehrud River to other provinces; some demonstrators damage the water pipes of the diversion infrastructure.

Headline: Explosive device detonates near a water facility in Iraq, killing one civilian
Description: On July 9, 2019, an explosive device detonates near a water facility in Shirqat, Saladin, Iraq, killing one civilian. No group claims responsibility for the incident.
Sources: National Consortium for the Study of Terrorism and Responses to Terrorism (START) 2019 ID. 201907090008

Headline: Demonstrators protesting over water, electricity, and jobs attacked by Iraqi security forces, with over 100 deaths
Description: Iraqi citizens publicly demonstrating to protest ongoing water, electricity, and job challenges are met with violent repression by Iraqi security forces. Over 100 people are killed within the first seven days of protests.

Headline: Water resources engineers from the Iraq Ministry of Water Resources are attacked while opening waterways to flood a marsh
Description: An team of engineers working on flood prevention from the Ministry of Water Resources in Missan Province, Iraq is attacked by an unidentified armed group while opening waterways to turn a flood into the areas of the central marsh. One death and one injury are reported.

Headline: Water pipeline for Amman Jordan sabotaged
Description: The Disi Water Conveyance Project, a pipeline sending over half of the water supply to Amman, Jordan, and the surrounding area, is sabotaged over 60 times in 2019, at times disrupting supply for five days. Rural communities that are experiencing extremely high rates of unemployment are thought to be behind the sabotage.

Headline: At least 11 people are killed in a conflict over access to water between pastoralists and farmers near the Kenya-Ethiopia border
Description: A deadly flight between farmers and pastoralists over a watering point near the Kenyan-Ethiopian border leaves eleven people dead, two injured, and four missing.

Headline: Kenyan school water tank poisoned
Description: A water tank at a primary school in Kirinyaga County, Kenya, is vandalized and poisoned. No one was harmed by the poisoned water.

Headline: A fight between farmers and pastoralists at a water source in Kenya results in serious injuries
Description: On September 20th, in Mkocheni village, Kenya, a fight between farmers and herders over access to a water source results in serious injuries.

Headline: Two herders are killed at water points in Kenya
Description: On March 24th, two herders are killed at water points at the border of Isiolo and Garissa counties, Kenya.

Headline: A dispute over the use of water resources turns violent in Kyrgyzstan
Description: On June 9, about 30 residents of Ak-Suu, Kyrgyzstan reportedly attack a couple because of conflicts over water.

Headline: Three people injured in a dispute over access to drinking water in Kyrgyzstan
Description: In July, violence over access to drinking water is reported in the Iskrinsk district, Chui region of Kyrgyzstan. Several people are reported hospitalized.

Headline: The water supply to Tripoli, Libya is cut off during war
Description: The water supply serving Tripoli, Libya's capital city, is cut off by gunmen that force employees managing the system to turn off the flow of water. The war is between Libya's National Army and UN-backed forces and has been ongoing since 2014.

Headline: Shelling and airstrikes destroy water supply systems in Tripoli during ongoing war in Libya
Description: Heavy shelling and airstrikes between April and June of 2019 destroy water infrastructure in Tripoli, Libya.
Sources: International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) 2019

Headline: 37 killed in herder-farmer conflict over water and land resources in Mali
Description: Thirty-seven civilians are killed in the ongoing conflict between herders and farmers who are fighting over access to water and land resources in central Mali.

Headline: More than 130 killed in Mali in conflict between hunters and herders over land and water
Description: More than 130 people are killed in the conflict between hunter and herder communities in Mali. In this instance, Dogon hunters are accused of attacking Fulani herders.

Headline: 50,000 people flee their homes in central Mali as conflict escalates over land and water
Description: A series of massacres in central Mali, fueled by conflict over land and water resources, causes 50,000 people to flee their homes.

Headline: Indigenous environmental activist killed in Mexico, reportedly over opposition to a project that threatens water and land resources
Description: Samir Flores Soberanes, an indigenous environmental activist from Mexico, is killed in his home for his opposition to the Proyecto Integral Morelos, a thermoelectric plant and pipeline that threatened local water and land resources. The Moreles state prosecutor claims that the murder has nothing to do with the thermoelectric plant project. The People's Front in Defense of the Land and Water for the states of Morelos, Puebla and Tlaxcala (FPDTA) state that the only enemies that Soberanes had were those involved with the project.

Headline: Pastoralists in Morocco fight with local residents and destroy water supply infrastructure
Description: On November 11, in Toumliline, Morocco, pastoralist nomads attack residents of the area with rocks and sticks, resulting in the destruction of water supply infrastructure.

Headline: Conflict over local drinking water leads to two injuries in Nepal
Description: On May 19, a group of people beat up a couple in Khamari locality of Siranchowk Rural Municipality near Gorkha, Nepal for blocking the registration of the drinking water source of the village.

Headline: Pakistan claims India's unexpected release of water from a dam is an act of war
Description: India releases water from a dam on the River Sutlej, causing moderate flooding downstream in Pakistan. India claims that the release is a "routine exercise" during monsoon season. The release and resultant flooding are seen as an act of war by Pakistan. This incident adds to the already strained relations between the two countries which have been at odds since February 2019 when 40 Indian parliamentary police were killed by a suicide bomb in Kashmir.

Headline: Two are injured in a fight over irrigation water scheduling in Pakistan
Description: On June 22, unidentified men attack and injure two people over irrigation water rotation scheduling, in Hamo Pota village, Pakistan.

Headline: A water dispute in Pakistan results in one death and other injuries
Description: On June 26, two tribal sub-clans attack each other with weapons and knives over a water dispute in Jangal Pir Alizai, Balochistan, Pakistan resulting in one fatality and injuries to two others.

Headline: Ten are injured in a dispute over irrigation water in Pakistan
Description: On July 6, two groups of Janwri community attack each other with sticks and metal rods over the rotation of water in Gharo village, Pakistan. Ten men are injured during the incident.

Headline: An irrigation water dispute kills one in Pakistan
Description: On July 23, the family of members of a Junejo community individual who was killed in a irrigation water dispute burn tires, block Sukkur-Larkana highway, and hold a sit-in along with the victim's body in Shikarpur district, Pakistan.

Headline: A protest over delays to repair of water and sanitation infrastructure in Pakistan leads to injuries
Description: On August 16, locals reportedly attack and injure four Water and Sanitation Authority staff at Gulberg Colony in Multan city, Punjab, Pakistan over delays in repair work.

Headline: A dispute over water rotation in Pakistan leads to one death
Description: On August 29, two groups of the Marri community attack each other with axes over a water rotation dispute in Dilshad village near Golarchi town, Pakistan, resulting in one fatality.

Headline: A clash over access to a drinking water fountain leads to injuries and a demonstration in Pakistan
Description: On September 10, police and Rangers resort to using batons and tear gas after supporters of three men who were injured during a clash over use of a water fountain blocked the road and demonstrated in Darya Khan Mari village, Sindh, Pakistan.

Headline: A dispute over water drainage in Pakistan results in seven injured
Description: On September 9, two groups from Tamma village attack each other with batons, sticks, and stones over a dispute about water drainage in their village near Islamabad city, Pakistan. Seven people are injured when one of the groups rammed their SUV against the other group's car.

Headline: Two groups exchange gunfire, killing two, over irrigation water in Pakistan
Description: On September 22, two groups exchange fire over a dispute about irrigation water use in Maidan Khwar area of Upper Dir district (KP), Pakistan resulting in two fatalities.

Headline: A clash over water sharing leads to at least eight injuries in Pakistan
Description: As reported on September 19, two groups clash after dispute about water sharing in the Multan district (Punjab), Pakistan resulting in injuries to at least eight persons.

Headline: A gunfight over the sharing of irrigation water in the Mangal area of Pakistan kills six and injures three others
Description: On July 7, members of two Pashtun tribes Pakha Khel and Maduzai exchange gunfire over a 40-year-old dispute regarding sharing of irrigation water in Mangal area of Pakistan. Six people are killed and three others sustain injuries.

Headline: A protest over the shortage of water and failure to maintain the city sewage system in Karachi, Pakistan leads to injuries and arrests
Description: On July 28, at least five people are injured in a clash between local activists, government representatives, and local political parties in Clifton town, Karachi, Pakistan over shortage of water and failure to maintain city's sewerage. Police intervene to disperse the demonstrators and arrest more than 40 demonstrators. Two police officers are also injured in the incident.

Headline: Workers clash over a water connection in Pakistan, injuring one
Description: On March 3, workers of PPP and PTI clash in Liaquatabad town, Karachi, Pakistan over water connections. At least one individual is reported injured.

Headline: One Israeli killed and two others injured at a spring in the West Bank
Description: A homemade bomb explodes at a spring, killing an Israeli teenager and injuring her father and brother. Springs in the occupied West Bank area have become hotspots for conflict between Israeli and Palestinian citizens who both visit during the summer while seeking to cool off from the heat.

Headline: Israel reportedly cuts off water supplies to approximately 1500 Palestinians
Description: Palestine News Network reports a water shut off to 17 Palestinian communities in Hebron, West Bank. The report suggests that the shut off was a purposeful act by Israel to force the movement of local Palestinians out of their homes to make room for more Israeli settlements.

Headline: Israeli settlers reportedly flood Palestinian-owned olive groves with sewage
Description: On October 27, Israeli settlers flood Palestinian-owned olive groves in the village of Deri al Hatab east of Nablus, Palestine with sewage water.

Headline: Construction equipment set fire at a dam construction site in the Philippines
Description: On February 8, assailants set construction equipment at a dam construction site on fire in Maysaysay, Quezon, Philippines. No group claims responsibility; however, sources attribute the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).
Sources: National Consortium for the Study of Terrorism and Responses to Terrorism (START) 2019 ID. 201902080001

Headline: A water system is destroyed in an attack in the Philippines
Description: On May 4, Cambalidio, Camarines Sur, Philippines is attacked; while no casualties are reported, a water system is destroyed in the incident. No group claims responsibility; however, sources attribute the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).
Sources: National Consortium for the Study of Terrorism and Responses to Terrorism (START) 2019 ID. 201905040041

Headline: A projectile is launched at a desalination plant in Saudi Arabia
Description: On June 19, a projectile is launched at a desalination plant in Shuqaiq, Jazan, Saudi Arabia. Houthi extremists claim responsibility for the incident.
Sources: National Consortium for the Study of Terrorism and Responses to Terrorism (START) 2019 ID. 201906190010

Headline: A water tank is targeted in an attack on the Somali National Army in Somalia
Description: On June 9, a water tank is targeted in an attack on the Somali National Army by Al-Shabaab, near Wanlaweyne, Lower Shebelle, Somalia.
Sources: National Consortium for the Study of Terrorism and Responses to Terrorism (START) 2019 ID. 201906090020

Headline: A water tanker is damaged in an attack on a convoy in Somalia
Description: On December 10, an explosive device detonates targeting a convoy in Isbartiba, Mogadishu, Somalia, causing an unknown number of casualties and also damaging a water tanker. No group claims responsibility for the attack.
Sources: National Consortium for the Study of Terrorism and Responses to Terrorism (START) 2019 ID. 201912100031

Headline: Al Shabaab militants flood a highway and ambush Somali soldiers who arrive to cut off the water
Description: On October 11, Al Shabaab militants ambush Somali military soldiers after they arrive to close the water gate of Hawaadley water storage opened by the militants to flood the highway between Bal'ad and Jowhar.

Headline: Armed clash erupts over water and grazing land near Afmadow, Somalia
Description: On January 16 an armed clash erupts between Bartire and Mohamed Zuber clan militias over water and grazing land near Afmadow town. There are several casualties on both sides during the clashes.

Headline: Fatalities and injuries are reported in a clan fight over access to water wells and land
Description: On January 15, clan militias in Somalia fight over water wells and land in the area. There are reports of fatalities and injuries.

Headline: One person is killed during a protest over the lack of water in KwaZulu Natal, South Africa
Description: On February 27, protesters blocked a road in Umzimkhulu, KwaZulu Natal, South Africa protesting the lack of water. Two protesters are shot and one killed.

Headline: Six police officers are injured during demonstrations demanding the restoration of water services in South Africa
Description: Around October 16, 2019 residents from Tshikota, South Africa demonstrate, demanding the restoration of water service in their area. Six police officers are injured and 12 demonstrators are arrested.

Headline: Two injuries are reported during protests over the lack of access to water in Pietermaritzburg, South Africa
Description: On May 20, residents from Henley Village, Pietermaritzburg, South Africa demonstrate over lack of access to water. Police use rubber bullets and teargas to disperse the crowds. Two demonstrators are injured and one is hospitalized.

Headline: Water shortages linked to child kidnappings in South Sudan
Description: Local authorities cite water shortages as a growing influence on the number child kidnappings in the Boma region of South Sudan. When there is a water shortage, shepherding communities spend more time on the move seeking water for their livestock, but, as a side business, they will also abduct children who can then be resold for profit.

Headline: One death and eight injuries reported in a dispute over grazing and water access in South Sudan
Description: On April 15th, clashes break out between pastoralists in the area of Manya , South Sudan in an apparent dispute over grazing and water access in the area. One person dies and eight are injured in the violence.

Headline: A fight over the price of water leads to deadly clashes in Sudan
Description: A woman was killed in a dispute over the price of water in El Gedaref, Sudan. This violent clash triggers more fighting between familial groups, leading to at least eight more deaths and dozens of injuries.

Headline: Water station serving 80,000 people damaged in Syria
Description: A water station in Basida, Idlib Governorate, Syria, serving 80,000 people is damaged by ongoing violence.
Sources: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (UNOCHA) 2019

Headline: Violence in northwest Syria damages civilian infrastructure including 29 individual water systems
Description: From January through July 2019 violence in northwest Syria leaves civilian infrastructure damaged and destroyed including at least 29 water stations serving approximately 610,000 people.

Headline: Turkey forces destroy Syrian power lines, leaving a city without water
Description: The Syrian city Al Hasakeh is left without water after Turkish military forces destroy power lines in the area. The attack also leaves at least 11 civilians dead and causes damage to other infrastructure.
Sources: Save the Children 2019; British Broadcasting Corporation 2019

Headline: Demonstrators in Tunisia wreck water pipes to a neighboring town, protesting water service interruptions
Description: Around July 3 in Jelma, Tunisia, demonstrators wreck water pipes delivering water to neighboring towns, demonstrating against water service interruptions.

Headline: Farmers stop the main water pumping station in El Hamma, Tunisia, disrupting local drinking water supply
Description: On July 22, farmers hold a demonstration and stop the main water pumping station in El Hamma, causing disruptions of drinking water in the area.

Headline: 9 water workers killed, 26 injured, in ongoing conflict in disputed region of Ukraine
Description: Nine water workers are killed and 26 are injured since the start of 2019 through July in the ongoing conflict in the disputed eastern region of the Ukraine. Additionally 58 sanitation facilities are damaged or destroyed.

Headline: Shrapnel damages a water pipeline, leaving more than three million people without water
Description: Shrapnel from an exploding shells damages a pipeline in the Siverski Donetsk-Donbass channel near Horlivka, Ukraine. The damages leave 3 million civilians on both sides of the conflict with either unreliable or no water supplies.

Headline: Eco-vandalism disrupts water diversions
Description: A water diversion system in the Colorado Rocky Mountains near Berthoud Pass is vandalized, disrupting water deliveries for several days. The act is suspected to be linked to ongoing tensions over water diversions from the Colorado River basin to Denver and other Front Range communities.

Headline: Two people shot while protesting water and electricity shortages in Caracas
Description: Two people are shot by police and paramilitary groups responding to the protests of citizens who have been without electricity or water for several weeks as a result of ongoing political fighting at that national level in Venezuela.

Headline: Five are hurt when a car hits them during a demonstration over lack of drinking water in Miranda state, Venezuela
Description: On April 10, five are hurt when a car tries to run them down during a demonstration demanding water in San Diego de los Altos, Los Teques, Miranda state, Venezuela.

Headline: Injuries are reported during demonstrations against the lack of water and electricity in Maracay, Venezuela
Description: On March 31, residents of Maracay, Aragua state, Venezuela protest blackouts and the lack of water. Five are wounded amid demonstrations.

Headline: Injuries are reported during demonstrations against the lack of water and electricity in Caracas, Venezuela
Description: On March 31, a protest is held in San Jose de Cotiza, in Caracas, Venezuela to protest blackouts and the interruption of water services. The protest is met by officials of the Faes, the National Guard, and armed militias of the ruling party. Two people are reportedly wounded by bullets.

Headline: One reported killed during protests over the lack of water and power services in Zulia state, Venezuela
Description: On April 5, in Santa Rita, Zulia state, Venezuela a man is shot dead by police and military officers during a protest demanding basic services such as electric power and potable water.

Headline: Mortar shells are fired severely damaging a water tanker
Description: Pro-Houthi forces reportedly fire mortar shells near the city of Hays in the south of Hodeidah Governorate, western Yemen. Several houses and a water tanker are severely damaged by shrapnel. At least one civilian is injured in the shelling.

Headline: A water well is shelled causing material damages in Yemen
Description: On January 5th, pro-Houthi forces shell a mosque and a water well in the Al Jabaliyah area of At Tuhayat district, Yemen, causing material damages. No injuries nor fatalities are reported.

Headline: Attempt to plant an explosive device in a water channel in Yemen results in one death
Description: On January 11, assailants attempt to plant an explosive device in the Qamt water channel and open fire on security forces in Taizz, Yemen. One assailant is killed. No group claims responsibility for the attack.
Sources: National Consortium for the Study of Terrorism and Responses to Terrorism (START) 2019 ID. 201901110035

Headline: During one of four attacks in the area, water tunnels and bridges are blown up in Yemen
Description: On May 29, water tunnels and bridges are blown up in one of four attacks in Ad Dali, Yemen. No group claims responsibility for the incident; however, sources attribute the attack to Houthi extremists.
Sources: National Consortium for the Study of Terrorism and Responses to Terrorism (START) 2019 ID. 201905290035

Headline: Assailants attack schools, houses, trucks transporting drinking water and other infrastructure in Yemen
Description: In early March, assailants use guns to attack schools, houses, trucks transporting drinking water, and other infrastructure in Al-Abaysa, Hajjah, Yemen. No group claims responsibility for the incident; however, sources attribute the attack to Houthi extremists.
Sources: National Consortium for the Study of Terrorism and Responses to Terrorism (START) 2019 ID. 201903080004, 201903090040

Headline: The destruction of a water plant leads to clashes in Yemen, killing and injuring many
Description: On November 26, clashes are reported between 'Abidah Al-Qaz'ah tribesmen and Islah-affiliated pro-Hadi forces after tribesmen established a roadblock to demand compensation for a water factory that was damaged in an airstrike and killed the son of the factory's owner. On November 28, reports alleged that 20 people were killed, most of them civilians, and 85 others injured in the clashes that lasted for several days. Fatalities spread over three days.

Headline: Airstrike hits water tank in Saada, Yemen
Description: On July 9, an airstrike by Coalition forces hits a water tank in Razih District, Saada, Yemen.

Headline: Air raid hits water truck and causes four civilian fatalities in Yemen
Description: On March 4, a water truck is hit in an air raid in Al-Sawadiyah District, Bayda, Yemen. Four civilians are also killed in the raid.

Headline: A water tank and a vehicle are damaged in an attack on a House Assembly member in Zimbabwe
Description: On August 21, House Assembly member Caston Matewu is fired upon, in Nyameni, Mashonaland East, Zimbabwe; a water tank and a vehicle are damaged but no casualties are reported. No group claims responsibility for the attack.
Sources: National Consortium for the Study of Terrorism and Responses to Terrorism (START) 2019 ID. 201908210017

Headline: Turkey takes control of Syrian water system in Allouk and interrupts water supply
Description: Turkey and Turkish-backed forces take control of the Allouk water station in northeastern Syria in October 2019. The water station, near the town of Ras al-Ain (Serekaniye), serves 460,000 people in al-Hasakeh governorate. Water pumping has been interrupted several times since the start of the year, with the latest interruption on March 29, 2020. Officials say the interruptions are a tactic to force Kurdish-led authorities to supply electricity to areas under Turkish control.

Headline: Several killed in an attack on a dam in Afghanistan
Description: Several military personnel are killed and others wounded during an attack on a dam, Machalugu village, Paktia province, Afghanistan.
Sources: Pettersson et al. 2021; Sundberg and Melander 2013

Headline: Protests in Algeria for improved water supply and energy leads to clashes with police and injuries
Description: On February 26, 2020, police forces and rioters clashed in Draa El Caid, Algeria over gas and water services, resulting in the injury of two police officers and several dozen rioters.

Headline: Protests in Caxito, Angola for improved water supply leads to clashes with police and injuries
Description: On August 5, 2020, people stage a demonstration in Caxito (Dande, Bengo, Angola) in support of employees who had not received their wages and against the lack of water supply in the region. Police used tear gas and live fire to disperse the demonstrators. Injuries and arrests are reported.

Headline: One death is reported in dispute over control of water in a refugee camp in Bangladesh
Description: On September 3, a dispute over access to water between Rohingya refugees and residents of the Chakmarkul Rohingya Camp (Teknaf, Cox's Bazar) in Bangladesh leads to a death.

Headline: A dispute over the control of local water resources turns violent in Bangladesh Two deaths and over 50 injuries are reported
Description: In late December, a dispute over control of local water resources between Shantipur village and Prajarkanda village in Itna Upazila (Kishoreganj), Bangladesh turns violent during local arbitration. Two people are killed and over fifty injured in the clash.

Headline: Over 100 injuries reported in a clash over access to water in local villages in Bangladesh
Description: On December 18, two groups of villagers clash at Baniachong Upazila (Habiganj), Bangladesh over control of a water body. Over 100 people are injured in the clash.

Headline: Protests against the water crisis in Pernik, Bulgaria turn violent, injuring at least 32 people
Description: On January 27, at least 300 residents in Sofia protest the water crisis in Pernik and clash with police. Police use tear gas and at least 32 people, including two police officers, are injured.

Headline: Deaths and injuries reported in a clash over the use of a water pump in Burkina Faso
Description: On July 11, members of Lobi and Dogosse communities clash over the use of a water pump for a Lobi customary rite in Tako-Yoyora (Loropeni, Poni), Burkina Faso. Three people are killed, two injured.

Headline: Six deaths reported in clashes over the use of water wells in Chad
Description: In January, members of the Arab and Boulala communities clash in the area of Djokhana (Dababa, Hadjer-Lamis), Chad over the usage of water wells. Six people were reportedly killed.

Headline: A dozen injuries are reported in violence over access to water for cattle in Chad
Description: Around June 1, youth militias from Kouri Bougoudi and Sakine, Chad clash over water for their cattle at Hadjar Hadid (Ouaddai). A dozen people are reported injured.

Headline: Demonstrations in Chile over land and water rights lead to conflicts with the police, injuries, and arrests
Description: In November 2020, demonstrations in the Los Rios region of Chile over land and water rights and other water concerns lead to conflicts with local police and arrests.

Headline: Egyptian hackers claim responsibility for a cyberattack on dam operations at the Ethiopian Grand Renaissance Dam
Description: Egyptian hackers launch a cyber attack on Ethiopian water systems in June 2020. On a Facebook page maintained by the hackers, they allude to Egyptian opposition to the Grand Ethiopian Renaissance Dam on the Blue Nile. The attack is carried out as the reservoir behind the dam is being filled despite the a lack of an agreement between Egypt and Ethiopia.

Headline: Ethnic violence between Afar and Somali groups in Ethiopia lead to injuries in clashes over water, grazing land, and other resources
Description: In late January, three Afar communal militiamen are shot and wounded by Somali ethnic forces in Garbo Ciise (Adaytu), Ethiopia. Clashes over grazing areas, water, and other resources are common in the area.

Headline: Afar and Somali forces clash over water and pasture land, killing at least 11
Description: Around March 12, at least 11 people are killed during armed confrontations between Oromo and Afar pastoralists in the Bordeda (Mieso) area, Ethiopia over water and pasture.

Headline: Injuries are reported in a demonstration over access to improved water and electricity in Guinea
Description: On July 14, residents demonstrated in Siguiri town (Siguiri, Kankan), Guinea to demand better electricity and water supply. Security forces fire tear gas to disperse them, injuring several people.

Headline: Security guards protecting a water pump reportedly used to flood land occupied by squatters is attacked in Guyana. At least one injury is reported
Description: On October 15, in Success, Demerara-Mahaica, Guyana two armed men attack a security guard protecting a water pump controlled by the Guyana Sugar Company. The company is accused of using the water to flood land to drive squatters out.

Headline: Three injuries and two deaths are reported in a dispute over drainage water in Madhya Pradesh, India
Description: On January 12, two unidentified groups fire at each other in Gwalior (Gwalior, Madhya Pradesh) India over the flow of drainage water, leading to two deaths and three injuries.

Headline: Two farmers kill their neighbor in a dispute over sharing water from a well in Madhya Pradesh, India
Description: On February 26, two farmers beat to death their neighbor in Majhgawan village (Chhatarpur, Madhya Pradesh), India during a dispute on sharing water from a well.

Headline: Four are injured in a land and water dispute in Thanamandi, India
Description: On March 1, four people attack a family in Thanamandi (Rajouri district, Jammu and Kashmir), India over a land and water dispute. Four members of the family are injured.

Headline: A dispute over drinking water stalls in Maharashtra, India leads to two deaths and one injury
Description: On April 27, two people die and one is seriously injured during a clash between two Muslim groups in the Shivaji Nagar slums of Govandi town (Mumbai city, Maharashtra), India over drinking stalls.

Headline: A dispute over water distribution in Budhal city, India leads to three injuries
Description: On May 19, a dispute over water distribution in Budhal city (Rajouri district, Jammu and Kashmir), India leads to three injuries.

Headline: The curtailment of water and electricity after cyclone Amhan leads to protests in Budhal, India. One injury is reported
Description: On May 26, a mob attacks police and Trinamool legislators in Kolkata city (Kolkata district, West Bengal), India while calling for restoration of electricity and water supply affected by cyclone Amphan. One injury is reported.

Headline: Officials inspecting the flow of water in Gulkani, Haryana, India are attacked. Seven injuries and 50 arrests are reported
Description: On July 1, around 50 people attack officials inspecting the flow of water into a pond in Gulkani village, Jind (Haryana), India. Seven policemen and officials are injured and 50 arrested.

Headline: Nine people are reported injured in a clash over wastewater in Fazilka district, Punjab, India
Description: Around September 2, a clash in Ramnagar Urf Jatwali village of Fazilka district (Punjab), India over waste water injures nine.

Headline: In a caste dispute, over two dozen Dalit are attacked with acid for using a handpump for water in Jhansi, India
Description: On August 25, a mob attacks and injures over two dozen Dalit people with acid in Basaar village in Jhansi (UP), India over using a handpump for water.

Headline: One person reported killed in clash over water in Kupwara, India
Description: On August 3, two families clash at Kacchama village in Kupwara city (Kupwara district, Jammu and Kashmir), India over a water dispute. One person is killed in the incident.

Headline: A fight over the laying of water pipes in Puri district, India kills two and injures more than ten
Description: On October 11, a fight over the laying of water pipes in Dimirisena village in Brahmagiri, Puri district (Odisha), India kills two and injures more than ten.

Headline: A demonstration over the shutdown of drinking water facilities in Manipur, India results in multiple injuries
Description: On December 7, demonstrations over the shutdown of drinking water facilities in Manipur, India results in multiple injuries of police and demonstrators.

Headline: Demonstrators in Gheyzaniyeh, Iran are injured while protesting water outages
Description: On May 25, police shoot tear gas and rubber bullets at demonstrators in Gheyzaniyeh, Iran demonstrating against frequent outages of water. Several injuries are reported.

Headline: Multiple cyber-attacks on Israel water infrastructure
Description: Several cyberattacks on Israeli water infrastructure are reported by the Israeli Water Authority. The attacks are aimed at agricultural water pumps in the Upper Galilee and on water and wastewater treatment systems in the central part of the country. No mention is given of who carried out the attacks, but previous similar attacks were attributed to Iranian hackers.

Headline: Israel detects and thwarts a cyberattack on water systems
Description: Israeli authorities link Iran to an attempted cyberattack aimed at disrupting water supplies in at least two locations in Israel in late April 2020.

Headline: A police officer kills one in a dispute over water in Brown's Town, Jamaica
Description: On December 14, near Brown's Town, Saint Ann, Jamaica, residents set tires on fire after an off-duty police officer shoots and kills someone in a dispute over water.

Headline: A water dispute between farmers in Kazakhstan turns into a riot, injuring 12
Description: On May 29, a water dispute between farmers near the town of Zhetisay of Turkistan region of Kazakhstan turns into a riot resulting in a dozen injuries. Police arrest two rioters.

Headline: A fight in Kenya between two clans over a watering point leaves one dead, 18 injured
Description: A fight erupts between two clans in the town of Arbeqarmso, Kenya, over a watering point. The incident leaves one person dead and 18 others injured.

Headline: Several killed in a fight over a watering point in Marsabit, Kenya
Description: In mid-June, herders clash over a watering point in Marsabit, Kenya. Several fatalities are reported.

Headline: Seven killed in clan dispute over land and water in Mandera, Kenya
Description: Around November 20, Garre and Murle clans clash over pasture land and water in Yado village, Mandera, Kenya. At least seven people are killed.

Headline: A major riot breaks out between Kyrgyz and Uzbek nationals over access to water; more than 200 people are hospitalized
Description: On May 31, a riot breaks out between dozens of Kyrgyz and Uzbek nationals over access to water sources near the village of Chechme on the border with Uzbekistan. Rioters hurl rocks at each other while setting properties on fire on both sides of the border. 200 Uzbek citizens are hospitalized in Sokh enclave including 13 with gunshot wounds; 25 Kyrgyz villagers are taken to the hospital in Kadamjai district with injuries of various degrees.

Headline: Clashes in Lebanon over water, electricity and energy shortages lead to injuries and arrests
Description: On January 13, demonstrators in Sidon city, Lebanon protest the crises in the country, including lack of water, electricity, gasoline, diesel, and gas. Clashes between rioters and military forces are reported, leaving five people injured and several arrested.

Headline: An attack on a water pumping station in Libya cuts of the water supply to 2 million people in the capital of Tripoli
Description: An armed group attacked a control station at Shwerif, Libya, cutting off the water supply to more than 2 million people in the capital Tripoli. The UN condemns the attack as "reprehensible."

Headline: Protestors injured in Tripoli, Libya, while protesting water shortages and other deplorable living conditions
Description: Several hundred people hold a protest of deplorable living conditions, including from water shortages, in Tripoli, Libya. Some protestors are injured from shots by security forces working to disperse the demonstrations.

Headline: Fighting in Libya continues to include attacks on water supply infrastructure
Description: Fighting between the Libyan National Army (LNA) and the internationally recognized Government of National Accord (GNA) leads to cuts in water and power to Tripoli when gunmen storm a control room, cutting water flows from the Great Manmade River Project.

Headline: Mexican military forces and farmers clash over water releases from a dam
Description: Farmers protest at the Las Virgines dam in northern Mexico where water is being held to repay a water debt to the U.S. Several hundred overtake control of the dam, causing property damage estimated at $4.6 million.  The farmers say that without the water, they will no longer be able to farm.

Headline: Demonstrations against a proposed privatization of the drinking water system in Mexico leads to injuries and arrests
Description: On November 30, in Chignautla, Puebla, Mexico, hundreds of residents demonstrate against the proposed privatization of the drinking water system. The demonstration turns violent. The municipal police intervene with pepper spray;  the demonstrators react by looting and burning the municipal presidency. Arrests and injuries are reported.

Headline: A clash over the installation of water tanks at a reserve in Chiapas, Mexico results in at least 10 injuries
Description: On October 25, in the municipality of San Cristobal de las Casas, Chiapas, Mexico in the Gertrude Duby reserve, a clash is reported over the installation of water tanks in the reserve. At least 40 people participate, shots are fired, and at least 10 people are injured.

Headline: Farmers in Mexico opposed to the delivery of water to the US attempt to take control of a dam; injuries and arrests are reported
Description: On September 8, in La Boquilla, Chihuahua, Mexico a group of farmers attempt to take control of La Boquilla dam to prevent the extraction of the water resources of this dam to satisfy an agreement with the United States. The participants clash with the National Guard using Molotov cocktails and machetes. The officers responded with tear gas. Injuries and arrests are reported.

Headline: A protest in Mexico against the cost of water services turns violent; at least 16 people are injured
Description: On May 14, in San Miguel de Allende, Guanajuato, about 80 people block a street to demonstrate against the cost of water service. About 100 municipal and state police intervene and 16 people are reported injured.

Headline: A dispute over irrigation water leads to a clash between conflicting political parties in Nepal
Description: On August 28, a clash related to watering paddy fields leads to dozens of injuries between cadres of Nepali Congress and JSPN at Kachanari village in Bariyarpatti, Nepal.

Headline: Seventeen people reported injured in a dispute over irrigation water scheduling in Pakistan
Description: On February 6, a clash erupts between two groups of the Gaho community, Kumb town, Pakistan, over water rotation. Both groups attack each other with sticks and axes injuring 17 people.

Headline: Two groups clash over irrigation water in Pakistan, with severe injuries to two people
Description: On May 8, two groups of Solangi community clash over water rotation in Mirpurkhas city, Pakistan. They attack each other with weapons, resulting in severe injuries to two men.

Headline: Four injuries reported in a dispute over irrigation water rotations in Pakistan
Description: On July 3, a clash takes place between two groups from the Janwri and Dhalo communities over rotation of water in Abdul Hakeem Dhalo village in Radhan, Pakistan. Four men are injured.

Headline: Three deaths and four injuries are reported in a gunfight over irrigation water rotation and money in Pakistan
Description: On July 7, a clash takes place between two groups of the Bhangwar community near Kandhkot city, Pakistan over water rotation and money. Both groups fire at each other, killing three men and injuring four others.

Headline: One injury reported in a fight in Garhi Khairo, Pakistan over irrigation rotations
Description: On August 5, a clash takes place between two groups of the Buledi community in Jnai Wandh village in Jacobabad, Sindh, Pakistan over rotation of water, causing injuries to one.

Headline: A fight over the rotation of irrigation water in Pakistan injures eight
Description: On September 12, a clash takes place between the Chandio and Solangi communities over the rotation of water in Zahra Machhi village in Radhan, Pakistan. Both groups attack each other with sticks, injuring eight men.

Headline: Israeli forces damage drinking water tanks while trying to disperse Palestinian protestors
Description: On May 15, Israeli forces use live fire, rubber bullets, and tear gas to disperse Palestinians protesting settlement policies in Kafr Qaddum. Two drinking water tanks are damaged during the event.

Headline: A Palestinian water network is damaged by Israeli settlers
Description: On December 13, a group of Israeli settlers from the Maaoun settlement attack a Palestinian's house and damage a water network in Sarura area of Yuta village.

Headline: A demonstration against the lack of water services in Senegal leads to injuries and arrests
Description: On June 22, 2020, residents demonstrate in Koumpentoum town (Koumpentoum, Tambacounda) against a lack of running water. One gendarme is severely injured and several demonstrators are arrested.

Headline: A protest over the lack of water services in Senegal turns violent and demonstrators and police are injured
Description: On May 30, residents demonstrate in Cap Skirring in Oussouye, Ziguinchor, Senegal against the lack of running water. They burn tires on the roads. The gendarmerie forces fire tear gas and live ammunition to disperse them; demonstrators reply with stones. Three demonstrators and three gendarmes are severely injured. 16 people are also arrested.

Headline: An armed clash over pasturelands and water resources is reported between militias in the Sanaag region of Somalia; injuries are reported
Description: On June 27, an armed clash is reported between a Husen Sub-Clan militia and Reer Garaad Sub-Clan militia, both from the Warsengeli clan, Sanaag, Somalia. The motive of the clash is believed to be disputes over pasturelands and water resources. At least six people are injured in the clan clash.

Headline: A clash over water and land kills one and injures three in Somalia
Description: On June 21, militias from the Leelkayse and Majeerten clans clash in the Deeralay area, Mudug, Somalia over water and land. One person is killed and three others injured in the clash.

Headline: Three youth collecting water are injured when attacked in South Sudan
Description: On November 14, three youth collecting water from the river Horse are wounded by armed militia in Torit county, South Sudan.

Headline: One death and several injuries are reported during a clash between farmers and pastoralists in South Sudan
Description: On February 22, farmers from Kuajiena county, South Sudan attack armed pastoralists from Tonj at a water point, leading to a firefight which kills one and wounds between three and five people.

Headline: The Sudanese Armed Forces clash with Amhara militants after the Ethiopians try to make use of river water in Sudan
Description: On May 28, Sudanese Armed Forces (SAF) clash with Amhara militia in the area of Barakat Norein, Sudan, after the SAF refused to allow the Ethiopians to make use of river water in the area. The area is claimed by Ethiopia. One Ethiopian militiaman is wounded.

Headline: A fight over access to water in the Al-Qatri camp for displaced persons in Syria leads to one death
Description: On May 15, a civilian is killed during clashes between displaced people in Al-Qatri camp near Idlib, Syria. Clashes erupted after residents of the camp lost access to water.

Headline: Two deaths are reported when Syrian militias fight with smugglers during a raid on water tankers
Description: On March 29, QSD forces clash with smugglers during a raid on water tankers in the town of Thiban in Deir-ez-Zor, Syria. Clashes result in at least two deaths and additional wounded.

Headline: Demonstrators storm a desalination plant in Tunisia, disrupting local potable water supply
Description: On September 23, demonstrators storm a desalination plant in Nagga, Kebili, Tunisia and interrupt the provision of potable water in the region to demand the pavement of a public road in their village.

Headline: Clashes over shared water point kills at least 10 in northern Uganda
Description: Clashes between South Sudanese refugees and local community members in Tika village near the Rhino refugee settlement in northern Uganda over access to a shared water source leave at least 10 dead, 19 injured, and several missing.

Headline: Attacks on water and sanitation systems in the Donbas region of the Ukraine cut off water services for civilians
Description: A resumption of aerial attacks between the Ukraine and Russia in the Donbas region again target water and sanitation systems, leaving civilians without running water in the midst of the Covid-19 pandemic.

Headline: White supremacists in the United States plot to poison water supplies
Description: In secret surveillance, the US Federal Bureau of Investigation records neo-Nazis recruiting members and plotting terrorist acts including poisoning water supplies in an effort to ignite violence. Seven arrests were made.

Headline: One injured during protests demanding water in Trujillo, Venezuela
Description: On May 11, in Carvajal, Trujillo, Venezuela, residents protest to demand water and are met with force by Special Action Forces (FAES). One person is injured.

Headline: One man is shot during protests in Miranda, Venezuela to demand potable water services
Description: On August 26 in Cupira, Miranda, Venezuela, residents protest to demand basic services including potable water and are met with force by municipal police.  One man is severely injured with a bullet.

Headline: Four are injured during protests in Cojedes, Venezuela over lack of public water services, including water
Description: On September 29 in San Carlos, Cojedes, Venezuela, residents protest the lack of basic public services such as water, electricity, and gas. GNB and CPNB officers arrest 12 individuals. Four people are injured by state security forces.

Headline: One death and multiple injuries reported during protests over lack of potable water and other services in Sucre, Venezuela
Description: On September 30 in Cariaco, Sucre, Venezuela, residents block a road to demand basic services including potable water, gasoline, gas, food, and electric power. State police officers arrive to disperse the group of people but are received with stones. One person is killed during the demonstration and an unknown number of people are injured.

Headline: Injuries are reported during a protest in Yaracuy, Venezuela demanding better potable water services
Description: On September 26 in Chivacoa, Yaracuy, Venezuela, around 60 people demonstrate to demand better basic services including potable water. National Guard and policy fire tear gas after rioters destroy the headquarters of the Mayor's office. An unknown number of people are injured and arrested.

Headline: Clashes over water resources in Yemen result in eight deaths and additional injuries
Description: On May 1, clashes between Al Tilan and Al Dahshal Ba al Harith tribal militias over water resources in Al Ghiwayl valley of Usaylan district (Shabwah), result in eight deaths and additional injuries.

Headline: Taliban attack a dam in Afghanistan
Description: The Salma hydroelectric dam is attacked by Taliban rockets. The dam, in western Heart province, is one of the largest in Afghanistan and provides irrigation water and electricity. The dam was completed in 2016 with the assistance of India.

Headline: A protest in Afghanistan over lack of clean drinking water and other services results in three deaths and more than 40 injuries
Description: On June 8, 200 demonstrators in the city of Fayzabad, Badakhshan, Afghanistan protest inadequate security and a lack of electricity and clean drinking water. The demonstrators clash with police, throwing stones and wood at security forces and setting fire to a tax collection office building. Three demonstrators are killed and 43 others were wounded after police responded by shooting.

Headline: Residents in Lumas, Albania protest against the use of a local water source, leading to at least one severe injury
Description: On May 21, locals protest in Lumas, Albania against the use of a water source for municipal purposes. The police use force when residents block the road severely injuring one protester.

Headline: Protests in Cangandala, Angola for improved water and electricity supply leads to clashes with police and injuries
Description: On September 25, 2021, protests in Cangandala (Cangandala, Malanje, Angola) to demand water and electricity are met with violence. Three injuries and eight arrests are reported.

Headline: A protest in Trelew, Argentina over environmental and water concerns of a mining project turns violent
Description: In December 2021 in Trelew (Chubut), Argentina, a group protests the approval of the mining project in Chubut's province, demand the law's repeal and improved protection of water. Multiple government buildings are set on fire; police respond with tear gas and rubber bullets; more than 30 injuries are reported.

Headline: Azerbaijan and Armenian forces clash over water
Description: On December 8, 2021, the Ministry of Defense of Armenia report that military forces of Azerbaijan open fire on a car belonging to the military of Armenia transporting water in the South-Western part of the Armenia-Azerbaijan border.

Headline: Protest over lack of irrigation water in Azerbaijan leads to at least one injury
Description: On September 28, 2021, residents of Nabatkend, Ortamugan and Kolpu villages of Saatly region of Azerbaijan protest the lack of irrigation water and control of water by "Baku oligarchs." Police intervene and injure a protester who was transported to the hospital.

Headline: One death is reported in a dispute over the control of a local water body in Bangladesh
Description: On October 3, armed assailant(s) shoot and kill a person at Digdair village in Tarail Upazila (Kishoreganj), over the control of a local water body.

Headline: A dispute between local residents and farmers in Tarata, Bolivia over the use of water lead to at least two injuries
Description: On August 18 in Tarata, Cochabamba, Bolivia locals and irrigation farmers clash near La Angostura dam after a blockade was implemented by the workers. The blockade was set up to demand the use of the water from the dam to irrigate land in the region. Local residents argue the water should be used for tourism and local fish farming activities. At least two injuries are reported.

Headline: Injuries are reported in a clash between farmers and miners over the Arque River in Bolivia
Description: On October 23, in Capinota, Cochabamba, Bolivia farmers and mining workers from Sicaya clash for control of Arque river and a watershed. Drought and a dispute over water for mining are the main issues. Three people were injured in the clash.

Headline: Militants sabotage electric lines near Ouorou, Burkina Faso, disrupting water access
Description: In December militants sabotage the electric lines and destroy a water pump near Ouorou (Toeni, Sourou), Burkina Faso cutting off the water supply to the area.

Headline: Violence over access to water leads to one death and two injuries in Cameroon
Description: On May 18, villagers fight in Waza village (Logone-et-Chari, Extreme-Nord), Cameroon over access to a water point. One person is killed, and two others injured.

Headline: A clash over access to water between different ethnic groups in Cameroon leads to at least 22 deaths and hundreds of refugees
Description: On December 9, armed men from the Musgum and Massa ethnic groups clashed with Arab Choas in Kousseri town (Logone-et-Chari, Extreme-Nord), Cameroon over the ownership of a water spot. At least 22 people were killed over three days; hundreds of people are displaced to N'Djamena in Chad.

Headline: Demonstrations in Chile over land and water rights and a hydroelectric plant lead to conflicts with the police, destruction of water system equipment, injuries, and arrests
Description: In November 2021, demonstrations in the Araucania and Biobio regions of Chile over water rights, a local hydroelectric power plant, and other water concerns lead to conflicts with local police, destruction of equipment from the Rural Drinking Water Project, shootings, and arrests.

Headline: Islamic State militants destroy a water tanker in Egypt
Description: On July 17, 2021, Islamic State militants target a water tanker with an IED in Sheikh Zuwayid (Al Shiekh Zuwaid, North Sinai), Egypt, destroying it.

Headline: Tigray People's Liberation Forces accuse the Ethiopian National Defense Force of conducting an airstrike against the Tekeze Dam in a dispute over control of local water resources
Description: On November 30, the Ethiopian National Defense Force conduct an airstrike in the Tekeze area targeting Tigray People's Liberation Front forces, in Asgede, Tigray, Ethiopia. The TPLF claim the government attacked Tekeze dam; the government deny the accusation and warn members of TPLF not to release the water from the dam. Casualties due to the airstrike are unknown.

Headline: A demonstration in France over the construction of irrigation tanks leads to the destruction of water infrastructure and a clash with police
Description: On November 6, demonstrators gathered in Cramchaban, France to protest the construction of 19 irrigation tanks in the area. They damage water pumps, burning equipment, and empty a water reservoir. Police respond with tear gas.

Headline: 11 people are reported shot in a fire fight over access to water in Guinea
Description: On May 17, villagers of Dankakoro and Banfelebougou villages, Guinea engage in fire fights around Dankakoro village over access to a disputed water point. 11 people are shot and injured.

Headline: Honduran environmental activist protesting construction of a new dam is shot and killed
Description: An environmental activist from the town of Nueva Granada, Honduras is shot and killed. He and his fellow community members had been protesting the construction of a new dam on the Ulua River in Honduras.

Headline: A Brahmin group assaults Dalit community members over drawing water from a shared well in Malarh, India
Description: On July 9, a Brahmin caste group assaults Dalit community members at Malarh village in Udhampur district (J&K), India, over drawing water from a shared well. Several Dalit community members are injured in the attack.

Headline: A Water Resources Department staff member was assaulted by farmers in Punjab, India over the alleged theft of irrigation water
Description: Around July 9, a staff member of the Water Resources Department, Punjab, India is attacked and injured by farmers in Lualaba village (Nabha, Patiala district), when stopped from allegedly stealing water from canals.

Headline: A farmer is killed in a dispute over irrigation water in Punjab, India
Description: On July 25, a farmer is attacked and killed by his neighbors in Kamal Wala village (Fazilka district, Punjab), India, over a water canal dispute.

Headline: One farmer is killed in a dispute over canal water irrigation in Punjab, India
Description: On September 23, a group of men allegedly attack a farmer and his son in Amarpura village (Abohar, Fazilka district, Punjab), India, over a canal water irrigation dispute. The farmer died.

Headline: Two killed in protests over water shortages in Iran
Description: Two men are killed during growing public protests over water shortages in Khuzestan province in southwest Iran. The shortages are occurring during the worst drought in 50 years, with protests in several cities and towns over residential and agricultural water cuts and power blackouts.

Headline: Farmers in Isfahan, Iran clash with police over water shortages and diversions of water from the region
Description: On May 25, farmers demonstrate in Isfahan, Iran over issues stemming from shortages and lack of access to Zayandehrud River water. A conflict with police result in several injuries.

Headline: Farmers protest lack of access to water and droughts in Isfahan, Iran. Several protesters are injured
Description: On July 4, farmers protest in front of the Isfahan provincial governorate building in Iran over lack of access to water and droughts affecting the Zayandehrud River. Police reportedly intervene, beating and injuring several protesters.

Headline: Deaths are reported in demonstrations in Khuzestan, Iran over electrical outages, water shortages, and the transfer of water out of the region
Description: In mid- to late-July, protestors clash with police and other security forces in Bandar e Mahshahr, Susangerd, Ahvaz, Izeh, and Aligudarz (Khuzestan), Iran over repeated and prolonged electrical outages, water shortages, and the transfer of water from Khuzestan to other provinces. Explosions and gunfire are heard and several demonstrators and at least one policeman is reported killed.

Headline: Local villagers and farmers tear down an earthen dam on the Dez River, Khuzestan, Iran in opposition to water diversions
Description: On June 14, local villagers and farmers tear down an earthen dam on the Dez River near the Dehkhoda Sugarcane Development Company, Seffak (Khuzestan), Iran in opposition to the diversion of water from the river.

Headline: Farmers protesting water shortages and drought are beaten and arrested in Shaban village, Iran
Description: On September 1, farmers protest water shortages and drought in Shaban village near Nahavand city (Hamadan), Iran. They are confronted by police who beat them and make several arrests.

Headline: Armed assailants injure four policemen in Shadegan, Iran, following protests and demonstrations over water shortages One death is reported
Description: On July 24, unidentified armed assailants open fire on and injure four policemen in Shadegan city (Khuzestan), Iran. The attack occurs in the context of continued tension and protests over water shortages. One police officer dies.

Headline: The main water pipeline diverting water from Isfahan to Yazd, Iran is destroyed by farmers and residents
Description: Around July 31, farmers and residents destroy the main water pipeline from Isfahan to Yazd around Isfahan, Iran.

Headline: Clashes continue between farmers and supporters and the policy in Isfahan, Iran over water shortages; dozens of injuries reported
Description: On November 26, farmers and supporters rally at the dried Zayandehrud riverbed and throughout the streets of Isfahan, Iran demanding the government address water shortages. Police attacked the demonstrators with tear gas, rubber bullets, and batons, and make between 60-214 arrests; the internet is shut down, and the city is put under security lockdown. Dozens of demonstrators are injured.

Headline: Residents in Kerman, Iran clash with police over wells drilled on their lands to transfer water to other regions
Description: On December 25, residents demonstrate in Shamsabad village (Kerman), Iran in protest over wells being drilled on their lands to transfer water elsewhere. Police clash with the protesters.

Headline: Protesters demanding improvements in water, sewage, and electrical services in Najaf, Iraq are attacked, injuring at least one
Description: On July 31, dozens of people protest to demand improvements in basic services such as water, sewage, and electricity in Najaf city, Iraq. Unknown militants attacked the protesters with knives, injuring at least one protester.

Headline: Unknown assailants attack an Iraqi security force during release of irrigation water from the Sabla River
Description: On December 6, unknown militants attack a security force in Rifai district of Thi Qar province, Iraq. The attack takes place while the Iraqi force is providing security during the release of irrigation water from the Sabla river.

Headline: At least six killed in clan disputes over land and water in Garbatulla, Kenya
Description: On January 9, militias from the Ajuran and Borana clans fight over land and water in the vicinity of Eldera village, Garbatulla, Kenya. At least six people are killed.

Headline: One killed and others injured in clan clashes over grazing land and water points in Marsabit, Kenya
Description: On January 13, armed gunmen from Dasenaach ethnic militia clash with a Gabra ethnic militia over a grazing zone and watering point in Sibiloi National Park in Madho Dimtu village, Marsabit, Kenya. One person is killed and two others injured.

Headline: While in search of pasture and water, militias clash with police at Laikipia Nature Conservancy, Kenya, killing at least one
Description: On July 31, militias clash with police at the Laikipia Nature Conservancy in Wangwaci village in Ol-Moran town, Laikipia, Kenya. One officer is killed. The militias invade several ranches in the conservancy in search of pasture and water.

Headline: Farmer/pastoralist violence over land and water lead to at least one death in Baringo region of Kenya
Description: On August 5, an unidentified communal militia shoot and kill a pastoralist in the Embosos area in Arabal village, Marigat, Baringo, Kenya. At least 38 cattle are stolen from pastoralists in search of pasture and water.

Headline: Multiple deaths and population displacements reported in clash between clans in Basuke, Marsabit, Kenya
Description: Around December 25, Degodia and Borana ethnic militias engage in an armed clash over scarce water and pasture at Basuke, in Marsabit county, Kenya. 11 people are killed and over 300 families are displaced by the conflict into Basir town in Wajir.

Headline: A water dispute in the Chui region of Kyrgyzstan results in at least one hospitalization
Description: On June 23, a resident of Iskra village near Tokmok city in the Chui region of Kyrgyzstan is assaulted by the villagers from a neighboring town following a water dispute. One hospitalization is reported.

Headline: Major clash over water kills more than 30 in Kyrgyzstan-Tajikistan dispute
Description: At least 31 people are killed, scores injured, and 10,000 evacuated after a dispute over access to water and water facilities leads to major clashes on a disputed Kyrgyzstan-Tajikistan border.

Headline: Border guards from Kyrgyzstan and Tajikistan exchange fire over a water source, killing dozens and wounding hundreds
