Description: Between April 28 and 30, 2021, border guards and rioters from Kyrgyzstan and Tajikistan exchange fire over the control of a water canal and pumping site along the Isfara River. Several dozen casualties and hundreds of hospitalizations were reported.
Sources: Raleigh et al 2010 ID. 7931294, 7931294, 7971544; Auyezov et al 2021

Headline: Violent clash over access to water in Lebanon leaves at least one injured
Description: On January 18, Msheik and Hjula clans clashed over access to water using guns and RPGs in Hai el Lailaki, Baabda, Lebanon. At least one injury is reported.

Headline: Sabotage to water infrastructure occurs in Hasawna, Libya
Description: Around July 13, an unidentified armed group carries out acts of sabotage to damage water infrastructure in Hasawna (Wadi Ashshati, South), Libya.

Headline: An unidentified group destroys a water plant providing water in Libya
Description: On July 29, an unidentified armed group blows up water station 353 on the Man-made River near Ash Shwayrif (Al Jabal Al Gharbi), Libya, disrupting water supply to Bani Walid, Misrata, Khoms, and Zliten.

Headline: Mauritanian protests over water shortages and electricity cuts result in injuries and arrests
Description: On July 2, the Mauritanian police use tear gas to disperse hundreds of residents of Kobenni, Mauritania protesting regular water shortages and electricity cuts affecting the city. One policemen is injured and several people are arrested.

Headline: Villagers  in Mexico fight over access to water supplies, with injuries and arrests
Description: On January 13, in Huejutla de Reyes municipality, Hidalgo, a clash between the communities of Coxhuaco II and Xiquila over access to water leads to injuries and arrests.

Headline: Two communities in Ciudad de Mexico clash over water infrastructure, with several injuries reported
Description: On July 20, in Ciudad de Mexico - Xochimilco, residents from two mountain communities clash with each other over a water project in San Mateo Xalpa. The confrontation was between supporters and opponents of the water work in the Cola de Conejo tank. Several people are injured.

Headline: A social activist protesting inadequate water service is shot and killed in Mexico
Description: On September 7, in Cuernavaca, Morelos, a social activist is shot and killed by two armed men in his house in Colonia Antonio Barona, Mexico. The victim led several protests to demand water service and created groups to prevent the Federal Commission of Electricity from suspending electricity to the wells.

Headline: A man who tries to rob a water pump in Mexico is beaten by local residents
Description: On December 10, in Oaxaca de Juarez, Mexico a man is undressed, beaten, and tied up after he tries to rob a water pump.

Headline: Civilians fetching water are killed by Islamic militants in Mozambique
Description: On October 22, Islamist militia attack and kill several civilians fetching water in Lumumua, Mozambique.

Headline: A pipeline carrying water to a joint Myanmar-China mine is bombed by a militia group opposed to the Myanmar military regime
Description: On September 9, in Salingyi township (Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), Myanmar a water pipeline transporting water from the Chindwin River to the Myanmar Wanbao and Myanmar Yangtze copper mines (a joint venture between China and a Myanmar military-owned holding company) is bombed by a local militia group. The group stated that the bombing was carried out because China had been ignoring the 'desires of Myanmar people for democracy and backing the military junta.'

Headline: The water supply for a factory is destroyed by opponents of the government regime
Description: On December 11, in Myaing township, Magway, Myanmar, members of the People's Revolutionary Army burn down and destroy water supply for a local factory. Locals said the military controlled the factory and soldiers were working there.

Headline: A dispute over the diversion of flood waters for irrigation in Nepal leads to 15 injuries
Description: On June 26, a group of locals, including a ward chairperson, clash with others in Maulapur municipality, Nepal over diverting flood water into local fields. 15 people are injured.

Headline: A fight over the rotation of irrigation water in Pakistan injures four
Description: On March 4, a clash takes place between two groups of the Bohra community over the rotation of water injuring four men in Pir Chandam village, Shikarpur, Sindh, Pakistan.

Headline: Two men are killed, three injured in a clash over irrigation water rotation in Pakistan
Description: On April 29, a clash takes place between the Mangrio and Nohani communities over the rotation of water. Shots are fired, killing two men and injuring three others in Tando Allahyar city, Pakistan.

Headline: A fight over the use of irrigation water in the Punjab, Pakistan injures at least eight
Description: On May 6, at least eight people are injured in a clash between two groups of villagers in Bahawalnagar district (Punjab), Pakistan over the usage of irrigation water in the village.

Headline: At least three are killed in a clash over the distribution of water in Pakistan
Description: On July 8, at least three people are killed in a clash including exchange of gunfire over water distribution in Dera Ghazi Khan city, Punjab, Pakistan.

Headline: A dispute over the construction of an irrigation water canal in Pakistan leads to two deaths and one injury
Description: On July 9, farmers shoot and killed two other farmers and injure one other in Faisalabad, Pakistan, over the construction of an irrigation water canal.

Headline: A dispute over the rotation of water results in injuries in Pakistan
Description: On July 25, two groups of the Khuhawar community attack each other with sticks, injuring one man in Sarang Khuhawar village, Pakistan. The dispute is over rotation of water.

Headline: Deaths and injuries are reported in a fight over water supply in Pakistan
Description: On July 27, two groups exchange fire killing two people and injuring seven in Tangoo Basi, Pakistan, over a water supply line.

Headline: A clash over shortage of drinking water, illegal fishing, and lack of electricity leads to two injuries in Pakistan
Description: On August 17, a demonstration in Gwadar city, Pakistan against water shortages, illegal fishing, and electricity cutoffs leads to a clash injuring two people.

Headline: Four are killed and eight injured in a fight over the distribution of irrigation water in Pakistan
Description: On August 1, two groups from the communities of Chandio and Bohar, Pakistan exchanged fire, killing four people and injuring eight, over the distribution of irrigation water.

Headline: An attempt to steal water from a government-owned water channel leads to gunfire and injuries
Description: On September 9, officials of an irrigation department are attacked in Faisalabad, Pakistan after refusing to let people steal water from a government-owned channel.

Headline: A dispute over canal water in Okara, Pakistan kills two and injures three
Description: On October 9, two people are killed and three are injured when armed men fire bullets at a family in Okara, Pakistan, allegedly over a canal water dispute.

Headline: A man is killed in a clash over irrigation water in the Punjab, Pakistan
Description: On October 8, a man was shot dead during a clash between two groups over irrigation water at Gagar village, Punjab, Pakistan.

Headline: Israeli settlers destroy Palestinian olive trees and irrigation systems
Description: On June 23, Israeli settlers uproot 10 olive trees and ruin water containers and an irrigation network in a Palestinian-owned farm in Wadi Qana, West Bank.

Headline: Israeli settlers destroy Palestinian olive trees and steal a water pump
Description: On June 28, 2021, Israeli settlers from the Ahya settlement uproot Palestinian-owned olive trees and steal a water pump and electric wires in the village of Jalud, Nablus.

Headline: Israeli settlers destroy Palestinian orchards and irrigation systems in Nablus, West Bank
Description: On July 2, Israeli settlers uproot 84 Palestinian-owned fruit trees and destroy irrigation pipes and water containers near the settlements of Shilo and Shvut Rachel in the lands of the village of Qaryut, Nablus.

Headline: Palestinians destroy water pipes that provide water to Israeli settlements in the West Bank
Description: On July 5, Palestinians destroy water pipes that provide water to Esh Kodesh and Migdalim settlements near Qusra, Nablus, West Bank.

Headline: Israeli military forces destroy irrigation water pipes in the West Bank
Description: On July 6, Israeli military forces raid the village of Al Jiwaya, Hebron, West Bank and uproot water pipes used for irrigation.

Headline: Israeli military forces destroy a Palestinian irrigation water tank
Description: On July 15, Israeli military forces demolish a Palestinian-owned water container of 500 cubic meters in Bayt Dajan, Nablus, West Bank, which was used for irrigation.

Headline: Israeli military forces destroy a Palestinian agricultural water tank
Description: On August 9, Israeli military forces demolish a Palestinian-owned agricultural water tank used for farming near Yabad, Jenin, West Bank.

Headline: Israeli military forces demolish agricultural facilities including a water well in the West Bank
Description: On August 11, 2021, Israeli military forces demolish agricultural facilities, including a water well, caravans, and agricultural rooms in Mosafer Yuta, West Bank.

Headline: Israeli forces demolish a medical unit, water well, and under-construction mosque in Hebron, West Bank
Description: On August 25, Israeli military forces demolish a medical unit, water well, and an under-construction mosque west of Yuta town, Hebron, West Bank.

Headline: Israeli military forces destroy an agricultural structure and water well in Bethlehem, West Bank
Description: On August 4, 2021, Israeli military forces demolish five Palestinian-owned agricultural store rooms and a water well in Wadi Rahhal, Bethlehem, West Bank, on the pretext of not having building permits.

Headline: Israeli military forces destroy a water distribution system in the West Bank
Description: On September 17, Israeli military bulldozers raze all roads and a water distribution system leading to Jabal Subeih in Bayta town (Nablus) to prevent access to the area.

Headline: Israeli forces destroy a water distribution network in the West Bank
Description: On October 25, Israeli military forces bulldoze a water distribution network and a road that links Palestinian villages with Musafer Yuta, Hebron, West Bank.

Headline: Israeli forces destroy Palestinian agricultural facilities, including water tanks
Description: On November 1, 2021, Israeli military forces demolish Palestinian-owned agricultural facilities  including sheds, water tanks, and solar cells in Khirbat Al Maytah west of Maskiyot Israeli settlement, West Bank.

Headline: Israeli forces destroy a water tank in the West Bank
Description: On November 1, 2021, Israeli military forces demolish a Palestinian water tank in Al Khadir (Bethlehem, West Bank) for not having a building permit.

Headline: A Palestinian-owned water spring is sealed by Israeli military forces
Description: On November 4, Israeli military forces seal a Palestinian-owned water spring east of Bayt Ummar, Hebron, West Bank, to prevent farmers from using it.

Headline: Israeli settlers damage a Palestinian-owned water well
Description: On November 6, Israeli settlers from the Yitzhar settlement damage a Palestinian-owned water well in the Nabeaa Sufli area, West Bank.

Headline: Israeli military forces dismantle or destroy agricultural equipment, including water tanks belonging to Palestinian farmers
Description: On November 7, Israeli military forces dismantle and destroy residential tents and sheds, including three water tanks, belonging to Palestinian farmers in Umm al Jamal, West Bank.

Headline: Israeli settlers destroy agricultural equipment, including water tanks
Description: On November 21, settlers from Avnei Hefetz break into a Palestinian-owned agricultural warehouse in Shufah village, West Bank, and destroy agricultural materials and water tanks.

Headline: Israeli military forces raze a Palestinian irrigation system
Description: On November 28, 2021, Israeli military forces raze a Palestinian water network (four kilometers long) used for agricultural purposes in Khirbat Atuf, West Bank.

Headline: Israeli military forces demolish a Palestinian water well; a protest results in multiple injuries
Description: On November 29, 2021, Israeli military forces demolish a Palestinian-owned water well in Nilin (Ramallah and Al Bireh), West Bank used for agricultural purposes. A protest against the destruction results in multiple injuries from rubber bullets and tear gas.

Headline: Israeli military forces confiscate Palestinian agricultural equipment, including five water tanks
Description: On 1 December 2021, Israeli military forces confiscate Palestinian-owned agricultural equipment in Khirbet ar Ras al Ahmar, West Bank, including tractors, vehicles, and five water tanks.

Headline: Israeli military forces demolish a Palestinian-owned house and a water well
Description: On December 7, 2021, Israeli military forces demolish a Palestinian-owned house and a water well in Abu Khashabeh, Hebron.

Headline: Israeli military cut down Palestinian olive trees and destroy a water well
Description: On December 14, 2021, Israeli military forces raze 120 olive trees belonging to Palestinians in Birin, West Bank and destroy a water well.

Headline: Six are injured during a protest in Peru demanding improved potable water and sewage services
Description: On January 11, in Tumbes, Peru, citizens of Cerro Blanco block a highway to demand improvement of the potable water service and sewage system. Police forces intervene and six citizens are injured.

Headline: Injuries are reported during a protest in Peru demanding the resumption of potable water and sewage services
Description: On March 2, in Las Lomas, Peru, protestors block the Sullana highway that leads towards the International Bridge with Ecuador to demand the resumption of a potable water and sewage works that have been paused for eight years. Police intervene with tear gas and the demonstrators fight back rocks. An unknown number of injured citizens are reported.

Headline: Residents in Senegal protesting bad water quality refuse to pay their bills and beat up water company representatives sent to cut off their water
Description: On March 22, residents beat up representatives the Sen'Eau national water distribution company in Mbacke, Diourbel, Senegal as they try to suspend the distribution of water to residents who had not paid their bills in protest of bad water quality.

Headline: A fight over a drinking water well in Xudun, Somalia kills at least ten people
Description: On April 16, a fight over a drinking water well between militias in the Dhabar-Dalool village near Xudun, Somalia kills at least ten people.

Headline: A fight over a water reservoir near Baxdo, Somalia kills two and injures three others
Description: On June 5, two clan militias fight over a water reservoir near Baxdo village, Galgaduud, Somalia. Two people are killed and three others are injured.

Headline: Injuries are reported in a dispute over water wells and land near Qorilow village, Somalia
Description: On June 25, Hassan Gaab clan militia clash with Cosoble Ali militia in Qorilow village, Somalia over water wells and land in the area. The injured are rushed to Warshikh town for medical attention.

Headline: A pastoralist is killed and four others injured in a dispute over land and water near Kismayo, Somalia
Description: On September 17, suspected Awramale clan militia shoot and kill a pastoralist from Majeerteen clan in the vicinity of Kismayo town, Somalia, in a dispute over water and land. Four other injuries are reported.

Headline: An attack on a water tanker delivering water to pastoralists affected by drought in Somalia kills four
Description: On December 2, an unidentified group attacks a water tanker delivering water to pastoralists affected by drought near Buulo Xaaji village, Lower Juba, Somalia. Four people are killed.

Headline: Militias in Somalia kill two in a dispute over water and grazing land
Description: On December 20, militias fighting over water and grazing land kill two from Hawadle clan near Banyaaley village, Hiraan, Somalia.

Headline: A fight over access to a water well escalates into extensive violence in the Upper Nile state of South Sudan, killing at least 17 and injuring more than 20
Description: On January 3rd and 4th, a fight over water access at a well escalates in the disputed border town of Meganis, Upper Nile, South Sudan.  17 are killed across two days of fighting and more than 20 are injured.

Headline: One death is reported in a fight over access to a water point in the village of Malual Deng Ngor, South Sudan
Description: On April 16, two groups of women armed with sticks fight over access to a water point in the village of Malual Deng Ngor in Yargot payam, South Sudan. One woman dies in the incident and five are arrested.

Headline: Multiple deaths are reported in violence over access to water between pastoralists and local militia in South Darfur, Sudan
Description: On March 1, Fellata pastoralists clash with Masalit militia in Gereida, South Darfur, Sudan after a member of the Fellata was killed at or near a water source. 11 more deaths are reported with another 36 wounded across two days of violence.

Headline: Multiple injuries are reported during demonstrations over cutoffs of water and electricity in North Darfur, Sudan
Description: On April 11, students in El Fasher, North Darfur demonstrate against poor living conditions including the interruption of water and electricity. Rioters block main roads and set fire to tires and at least six members of the armed forces and several students are injured.

Headline: Russian warplanes destroy an agricultural water pumping station near Idlib, Syria
Description: On July 3, Russian warplanes launch airstrikes on the water pumping station in al Rouj area in Idlib, destroying the station that served over 3500 hectares of farmland. No fatalities or injuries are reported.

Headline: A water station is destroyed near Ar-Raqqa, Syria
Description: On July 17, an IED planted by an unidentified armed group in Beir Al-Hashim in Ar-Raqqa detonates inside the well project and renders the water station inoperable.

Headline: Demonstrators in Kiev, Ukraine rally, including, against renewal of water supplies to Crimea, resulting in violent clashes with police
Description: On August 14, activists demonstrate in Kiev, including against the implementation of the Steinmeier formula on Donbas conflict settlement and the renewal of water supplies to Russia-occupied Crimea. The demonstrators provoke clashes with police using tear gas, tires, and other items. As a result, eight officers are reportedly injured.

Headline: Shelling by rebel forces in Donetsk, Ukraine cause blackouts and one village to loose water supply
Description: On August 11, the NAF rebel forces fire mortars at the governmental positions near Novomykhaylivka, Donetsk, Ukraine. As a result of the shelling, one Ukrainian soldier is injured, and the territory of the farm and the power transmission line are damaged, causing blackouts of settlements and leaving Novomykhaylivka village without water supply.

Headline: Ukraine blocks access to water from the Dnieper River to Crimea during their conflict with Russia
Description: Ukraine blocks Crimea from access to 85% of their water supply from the Dnieper River to add pressure to Russia in the ongoing fight over control of the region. Citizens of Crimea are forced to ration water.

Headline: Hacker successfully manipulates chemical treatment systems at a Florida water treatment plant adding dangerous levels of sodium hydroxide to the water system
Description: A hacker gains control of a small water treatment plant's chemical dosing computer program, causing the addition of dangerous amounts of sodium hydroxide to the community drinking water system. Staff spot the cyberattack and prevent contaminated water from being released to the community.

Headline: A car injures a demonstrator from tribal groups in New Mexico, United States, protesting the construction of a water pipeline
Description: On February 24, demonstrators from Kiowa and Cheyenne Tribes rally at a construction site in Taos, New Mexico against the construction of a water pipeline in protest of how the Abeyta Water Rights Settlement is being implemented. A driver hits a demonstrator.

Headline: Demonstrators opposed to the Line 3 oil pipeline in Oregon and supporting water rights and other causes are injured when the demonstration turns violent
Description: On March 11, about 100 people gather for a 'Stop Line 3' demonstration in Portland, Oregon, United States in support of abolishing ICE, protecting water rights and quality, and against the proposed Line 3 oil pipeline expansion. The demonstration turns violent when around 50 to 60 demonstrators light fires, smash windows, and pull protective plywood off a federal courthouse. Federal officers fire tear gas and chemical munitions to disperse the crowd resulting in injuries and arrests.

Headline: A fight over a water well in Wadi al Barkani, Yemen injures six
Description: On January 8, unknown militias clashed in Wadi al Barkani, Yemen over a water well, injuring six people.

Headline: Eight are killed and many others injured in a fight over a water well in Al Yatmah, Yemen
Description: On February 13, 2021, militias affiliated with the Juayd Tribe clash with militias affiliated with the Al Hussein tribe and soldiers from the pro-Hadi 7th brigade in Al Yatmah (Khabb wa ash Shaaf) over a water well. The clashes result in eight fatalities and dozens of injuries.

Headline: A water project in Al Hudaydah, Yemen is attacked
Description: On June 16, Houthi attack the Al Khamiri water project in Hays city (Al Hudaydah), Yemen. According to the source, the work on the water project is interrupted by the attack.

Headline: Landmines planted around a water pipe in Yemen are defused The mines would have disrupted the Al Hudaydah city water supply
Description: On August 13, the National Resistance forces engineering team defuse Houthi landmines planted around a water pipe near the Red Sea Mills company in Al Hudaydah, Yemen. According to the source, the mines were going to disrupt city water supply.

Headline: A clash over a proposed water project in Al Ashah, Yemen results in three deaths and one injury
Description: On September 5, clashes erupt between Sufyan and Al Usaymat tribesmen in Al Ashah, Yemen over a water project that Houthi forces are planning on implementing in a contested area between the two tribes. The clashes result in three fatalities and one injury.

Headline: Saudi-led air raids target the Rural Electricity and Water Authority in Aththaorah district, Yemen
Description: On October 21, Saudi-led coalition air raids targeted Aththaorah district, Yemen, striking the Rural Electricity and Water Authority. The Saudi-led coalition claims to have struck Houthi sites used for launching drones and ballistic missiles in Sanaa.

Headline: A conflict over control of and access to water results in one death to a child collecting water in Yemen
Description: On October 24, 2021, clashes between Abu Shusa tribesmen and Sabara tribesmen supported by Houthi forces result in the death of a child in Wadi Mawr (Al Maghrabah, Hajjah), Yemen as the child was getting water from the area. According to one source, Houthi forces prevent citizens from other tribes from collecting water in the area claiming that it is within 'Hashemite property'.

Headline: A water well is damaged after Houthi forces target civilian farms in Al Hudaydah, Yemen
Description: On November 4, Houthi forces target civilian farms in At Tuhayat district (Al Hudaydah), Yemen, with mortars damaging a water well. Casualties are unknown.

Headline: Saudi-led air raids target the Water and Rural Corporation in Yemen
Description: On December 9, Saudi-led coalition air raids again target the Water and Rural Corporation in Aththaorah district, Yemen, damaging civilian property. Casualties are unknown.

Headline: Airstrike hits rural water and electricity authority in Sana, Yemen
Description: On September 12, an airstrike hits a rural water and electricity authority in Al-Thawrah District, Sana, Yemen.

Headline: Militants attack villages in Mali, killing four and destroying water infrastructure
Description: On January 3, ISWAP (Greater Sahara) militants attack the villages of Labodji, Doreye, and Oussadia, in Gao, Mali. Four people are killed, houses burned, and a water tank is destroyed.

Headline: Israeli military demolish Palestinian agricultural facilities in West Bank, Palestine, including a water tank
Description: On January 4, 2022, Israeli military forces demolish Palestinian-owned agricultural facilities in Ibziq, West Bank, including a water tank.

Headline: A water tanker is attacked by Al Shabaab militants in Somalia killing ten and injuring 15
Description: On January 1, Al Shabaab militants detonate a remote-controlled IED, targeting an Ethiopia forces water tanker near Feerfeer village, Somalia. Al Shabaab claims ten soldiers are killed and 15 others injured.

Headline: Russian warplanes attack the water station near Idlib, Syria damaging the water system and injuring at least one
Description: On January 2, Russian warplanes conduct airstrikes on the vicinity of Sijer - Bqesemtoh town water station near Idlib, Syria, damaging the pipes and rendering the station inoperable. At least one worker at the water station is injured.

Headline: Russian troops destroy Ukrainian dam that blocked water to Crimea
Description: In late February, Russian troops invading Ukraine reportedly destroy a concrete dam built in 2014 to cut off water to Crimea after Russia annexed that region. The canal was originally built to provide water from the Dnieper River to Ukraine's Kherson region and Crimea.

Headline: Airstrike hits water tanks in Saada, Yemen
Description: On November 1, an airstrike hits water tanks in Sa'ada District, Saada, Yemen.

Headline: Ukrainians flood land to slow Russian advance on Kyiv
Description: Ukraine intentionally releases water from a dam on the Dnipro River flooding land north of Kyiv to slow the advance of Russian armored columns. The water creates a major barrier to Russian forces and aids in the defence of the Ukrainian capital. The Russians later shell the dam, damaging it.
